snippet: Deputy Secretary of State William J. Burns arrived in Cairo on Monday at a time when both sides of Egypt’s crisis have exhibited strong anti-American sentiment.
abstract: Deputy Secretary of State William J Burns, in visit to Cairo, warns that Egypt's generals will jeopardize country's second chance at democratic transition if their new interim government continues to crack down on Islamist supporters of former Pres Mohamed Morsi; remarks offer clearest statement yet of United States' position on military ouster of Morsi.

byline.original: By DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK and KAREEM FAHIM

lead_paragraph: Deputy Secretary of State William J. Burns arrived in Cairo on Monday at a time when both sides of Egypt’s crisis have exhibited strong anti-American sentiment.

headline.main: U.S. Warns Egypt’s Generals Against Jeopardizing ‘Second Chance’ at Democracy
headline.print_headline: U.S. Warns Egypt’s Generals Against Jeopardizing ‘Second Chance’ at Democracy

keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
keywords.name: subject
